channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Education Department stops $1 billion in funding for school mental health
item.description: Congress created the grants in the aftermath of the school shooting in Uvalde, Texas. The goal was to help schools hire mental health professionals, i...

item.title: Freedom of speech 'at stake' in Columbia student Mohsen Mahdawi's case, lawyer says
item.description: Columbia University student Mohsen Mahdawi left federal prison, but his case isn't over. His lawyer says the Trump administration's case against him i...

item.title: The U.S. set the global order after WWII. Trump has other plans

item.title: Lawmakers demand answers after a Haitian woman dies at an ICE detention center

item.title: Judges would be accountable for abuse even if they retired or resigned, under new bill
item.description: A new bill from a top Democrat seeks to close a loophole that federal judges have used to collect pension benefits despite facing credible accusations...

item.title: Ros Atkins on... What's in the US-Ukraine resources deal?
item.description: The BBC's analysis editor looks at what has been agreed in the much-anticipated agreement.

item.title: Behind Florida's "Operation Tidal Wave" targeting migrants for deportation

item.title: 5/1: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: New economic data shows the U.S. economy shrank early this year. Also, Tessa Bonhomme and Julia Tocheri on women’s hockey podcast "Jocks in Jills."

item.title: Tanzanian priest - and government critic - brutally attacked
item.description: The attack on a Catholic priest comes amid rising political tensions ahead of October's elections.

item.title: Next round of Iran-US nuclear talks postponed
item.description: The delay comes after Washington imposed new sanctions targeting Iran on Wednesday.

item.title: Water Safety Month kicks off with urgent call to protect kids from drowning

item.title: Details on U.S.-Ukraine minerals deal

item.title: National Security Adviser Mike Waltz to leave role, US media reports
item.description: Waltz was under pressure after a journalist was mistakenly added to a group chat in which senior officials were discussing military strikes.

item.title: Deadly clashes in Syria's Druze areas raise fears of widening unrest
item.description: The sectarian violence involving Islamist factions, security forces and Druze gunmen is another sign of the fragile security situation.

item.title: Iowa immigrant group is alarmed by a state lawmaker’s demand for confidential information
Takeaways from AP’s report on how Trump’s immigration crackdown resonates in the Texas Panhandle
